alert.note: Alert for Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 1:39PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Mainland Monroe and central Miami-Dade Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 139 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Loop Road Ee Center, or 27 miles west of Homestead General Airport, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shark Valley Obs Tower and Everglades National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.
